posts.post_content:
It can get countered. 0.5 / 5.  
  
~  
  
On a serious note...WOW! She's like the polar opposite twin to [Baneslayer Angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Baneslayer Angel). While Baneslayer kicked ass in combat and gained you a lot of life, Sigarda is less effective in combat, but is 99% protected from removal. She's pretty much a [Thrun, the Last Troll](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Thrun, the Last Troll) on wings. The fact she is legendary kind of balances her...I guess...  
  
Her popularity all depends on how much people can up with for a WG deck, which doesn't seem to be that popular right now. If a some good decks arise, you can bet your Lotuses that she's going to be the frontliner f all of them!

posts.post_content:
This is the most love Wizards has given white/green since... I think [Knight of the Reliquary](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Knight of the Reliquary).  
I mean, blue/black gets nifty tools to play with in every set, white/blue too. But some of the other color pairs have been neglected. See [Novablast Wurm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Novablast Wurm) if you want an example of something I'd consider a past failed attempt.  
Sigarda's got it goin on, though. How do expect to kill her in block? Like, at all? You have [Blasphemous Act](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Blasphemous Act), [Terminus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Terminus), and that's actually pretty much it.
posts.html:

Posted By: KyojiFoxfire (5/1/2012 7:40:18 PM)

posts.post_content:
Too powerful, I don't like it. Her abilities narrow the range of stuff that can kill her so much that she'll be format warping on her own. It'll certainly keep [Phyrexian Metamorph](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Phyrexian Metamorph) and [Phantasmal Image](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Phantasmal Image)'s prices pretty high and it will probably bring [Day of Judgement](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Day of Judgement) back into style quick smart.  
  
At least with Thrun (also not a fun card) you could fly over him or outsize him with a defender. Sigardia is going to remain relevant for the whole game, either hitting you or blocking.
posts.html:
Too powerful, I don't like it. Her abilities narrow the range of stuff that can kill her so much that she'll be format warping on her own. It'll certainly keep Phyrexian Metamorph and Phantasmal Image's prices pretty high and it will probably bring Day of Judgement back into style quick smart.

At least with Thrun (also not a fun card) you could fly over him or outsize him with a defender. Sigardia is going to remain relevant for the whole game, either hitting you or blocking.

Posted By: Renegade_Punk (5/2/2012 9:33:54 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
@wooplin  
  
"HA! You can't stop my Shape Anew!!!!  
  
"Ruling: 1/1/2011  
'If the targeted artifact's controller can't sacrifice it (due to Tajuru Preserver, perhaps), the other effects of the spell will still happen.'"  
  
Unless the situation you're describing is one of your opponent is playing [Shape Anew](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Shape Anew) on one of your creatures, I don't see how this is relevant. For Sigarda's ability to do anything, the spell has to be controlled by one of your opponents and also has to be making you sacrifice a creature. So I guess in the corner case where you have Sigarda and [Blightsteel Colossus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Blightsteel Colossus) out and your opponent tries to Shape Anew it, yes, the Colossus stays in play and you get your polymorph effect.
posts.html:
@wooplin

"HA! You can't stop my Shape Anew!!!!

"Ruling: 1/1/2011
'If the targeted artifact's controller can't sacrifice it (due to Tajuru Preserver, perhaps), the other effects of the spell will still happen.'"

Unless the situation you're describing is one of your opponent is playing Shape Anew on one of your creatures, I don't see how this is relevant. For Sigarda's ability to do anything, the spell has to be controlled by one of your opponents and also has to be making you sacrifice a creature. So I guess in the corner case where you have Sigarda and Blightsteel Colossus out and your opponent tries to Shape Anew it, yes, the Colossus stays in play and you get your polymorph effect.

posts.post_content: This card is by far the best Legendary, if not THE best angel in Avacyn Restored simply due to the fact that she is the cheapest to cast out of all her sisters and is harder to remove than them, save Avacyn. In her colors, she can easily be cast turn four, and most players won't have an answer to a 5/5 hexproof flier that early in the game. 4.5/5 at least.

posts.post_content:
@StoicChampion  
  
You have nothing in that list that gives you shroud. Therefore, I choose [Sudden Spoiling](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sudden Spoiling) followed by [Anarchy](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Anarchy). Then when you cast [Ghostway](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ghostway), I play [Evacuation](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Evacuation).  
  
Alternatively, here are some ways to deal with your scenario without ever targeting anything:  
  
[Martyr's Cry](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Martyr's Cry)  
[Bane of the Living](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bane of the Living)  
[Arena of the Ancients](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Arena of the Ancients) + [Angel's Trumpet](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Angel's Trumpet)  
[Everlasting Torment](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Everlasting Torment) + [Slagstorm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Slagstorm), etc.  
[Ichor Rats](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ichor Rats) + [Steady Progress](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Steady Progress)  
  
Etc.
